data.title: It's....Good
data.text:
The first time I ever ate Neapolitan pizza I was disgusted by how soggy it was in the middle.  Years later, I'm obsessed.  I read a lot of complaints about the soggy pizza, but that's how Neapolitan pizza is.  If you don't like that, you should definitely avoid this place.  If you do, give it a shot!  That being said, Neapolitan pizza crust should be thin, and this crust was much thicker than I expected.  It was too doughy and left me a little underwhelmed. 

The restaurant is small!  Much smaller than I expected, so expect to wait.  The pizzas are surprisingly expensive.  They do have olive oil at each table and I highly recommend dipping your crust in the olive oil.  

There were used drinking cups and silverware stacked at our table when we were seated and never removed.  I was a little surprised by that.

Overall, it was not my favorite Neapolitan pizza but I would definitely return.

data.title: Artisan pizza
data.text: Amazing pizza right here in a college town.  Great dough, fresh ingredients and warm service.  A must stop in champaign

data.title: An authentic Neapolitan pizza
data.text:
I consider myself lucky to have such a great real Italian pizza place at just 30 minutes drive from the place I live!  Their pizza is better than many pizza place in Italy!
The ingredients are fresh and imported from Italy. I recommend this pizza to a sofisticated public, who knows about authentic pizza. Public who like franchise pizza restaurant, won't probably like this pizza. Also people who never experience the Italian delicate food taste, won't appreciate the quality of this pizza. Great selection of Italian wines too! Yes, the service could be improved, but still is acceptable. I would like to see the owner around more often!

data.title: AWFUL Experience
data.text: There was little to recommend here.  The service was very poor and the pizza was actually cool as if it had been refrigerated.  The one saving grace...the cold pizza tasted good.

owner_response.author: Ramin K, Owner at Pizzeria Antica, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
More information would be helpful to Antica as we really don't know how a pizza coming out of a 1000 degree oven could arrive at your table "refrigerated".  

How exactly was the service poor? 

Our work environment is one of respect for Antica, respect for the food we serve, respect for our costumers, and finally, respect for each other as Antica workers.  We know that this all around respect translates into a positive dining experience as evidenced in the other reviews.  How this process broke down during your visit would be informative.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great Crust & Unusual Toppings!
data.text: Love the crust on their pizza, the cook at 1200 degree F in a wood burning oven so it is nice and crisp. Tasty and unusual toppings, my personal favorite is Pistachio & Italian ham. My husband says the pepperoni which are spicy and thick are the best he has ever had. Love the pop from the bottle, so much better than from the can. Good Italian beers. Not to keen on the way you are seated here, kind of hit and miss if anyone sees you are up front waiting or when you are ready to leave to ring up your bill but well worth visiting!

data.title: New find
data.text: Stumbled across this  restaurant. The pizza oven cooks your pizza super fast.  We had the pepperoni pizza, and both had gelato.

data.title: One of the best.
data.text:
There is a pretty simple  menu here.
The biggest choices are witch pizza to order  and what you are drinking.
The price is higher for the pizza but the quality is there.The have a good variety of alcohol. I don't  think the alcohol is worth the price they ask.5$ beer,low end.Not for me.3 choices  for appetizers and salads.and desert.

data.title: Delicious!
data.text: The workers were wonderful, from the girl at front door to the waiters - everyone so friendly and helpful.  Great experience for the kids with us too.  Pizza was so flavorful - so fresh.  Also had some gelato - loved it!  Definitely recommend and want to go back.

data.title: “Fresh from the oven”
data.text:
Pizza is one of those dish’s that is really hard to mess up and at times becomes monotonous.  Thats why Pizzeria Antica is a great change of pace.  An authentic Neapolitan pizza experience complete with wood fired ovens imported from Naples Italy.  The pizza’s are full of fresh ingredients and come out quick during this process (less than 2 minutes), so if you would like time to enjoy one of their Antipasti plates or great salads I would suggest you hold off ordering your pizza until you receive your starters.

The flavors are layered and robust and the service is exceptional. In addition imported Italian wines and beer along with espresso are available to compliment your Neapolitan experience.
Finish off with one of the many gelato options available.  Antica is a great addition to the downtown Champaign culinary scene.

data.title: Best European Style Pizza in town!
data.text: I've had wood fired pizza in Europe, Eastern Europe and all over the US.  This is fantastic pizza with fresh real Italian ingredients.  You pay a bit more, but the pizza is truly memorable.  Presentation is beautiful and the antipasti are great. New favorite!

data.title: Just as good Italy
data.text: Honestly, I found the pizza to be as good as what I had in Italy. The pizza is prepared quickly. I recommend each individual getting their own pie. You'll want to eat the whole thing.

data.title: Great pizza
data.text: Loved the pizza.  We had the four cheese (made with local goat cheese) and the Margherita pizza.  Owner was very friendly.  Tea and water were served in carafes.  Italian wine and beer available.

data.title: Great pizza...  The service was slow, but I believe we caught them on an off-day.
data.text:
Wonderful pizza.  I found it to be every bit as good as pizza in Italy (well, nearly as good).    The crust was cooked to perfection, and the toppings were very fresh.

We were there on a Sunday, and the service was slow.  I suspect that a server had called in sick.  ("A" for effort to the lone waitress that tried her best to cover all patrons.)

data.title: Fresh salad, vegan pizza, & pistachios
data.text: I had a wonderful experience here. My partner and I went in on a slow Monday, shortly after they opened. Atmosphere inside was cool but we chose outside seating. Ordered the pistachio and arugula pizza (without the mortadella), and the vegan option (I prefer to not support the dairy/meat industries). Both delicious. Loved the sweet red peppers that burst in my mouth. At the counter, was contemplating getting a salad but was hesitant because of prices. The person ringing us up (I think it was the owner) said he would just throw in a house salad at no cost. Very enjoyable and fresh. (Now don't expect 'em to do this for everyone -- he probably offered this kind gesture because they were slow and 30 min from closing that night/just opened the restaurant -- but still, super appreciated!) Nice addition to the C-U pizza scene.

data.title: True Italian Flate
data.text: Just had the Pistachio pizza at Antica and its one of the best pizzas I've ever had!!  Seriously, most of the cheeses, meats, etc are not just your ordinary pizza toppings. This place goes above and beyond for great toppings for 10" pizzas. Gelato from Italy; beer and wine too. Lavazza coffee shots. Great ambiance and terrific service. Highly recommend this pizzeria

data.title: Great pizza
data.text: They made a great pizza with amazing toppings.  I can't think of another pizza place that provides these type of toppings in the area.  A great place for a date.

data.title: downtown pizza
data.text: great location downtown champaign.  brick and mortar inside.  so cool.  Brick ovens.  Rustic Italian pizzas. very good.  I added olive oil, red pepper flakes, and black pepper.  kicked it up a notch.  chianti is terrible but my coworker had the pinot and loved it.  definitely will go back.

data.title: Before boarding Amtrak train
data.text: Saturday night, needed place to eat before taking train South. Thought pizza would be nice. Disappointed, pizza was soggy, 10 inch. Only one size, $14.  Was not hot. Got cold fast. Bacon pizza had strips of bacon fat not bacon at all. We had Two pizzas for 4 people. Still Hungry when we left. The other pizza we had had Italian sausage, tomatoes, clumps of mozzarella cheese and they said hot olive oil. Thought olive oil meant oil was heated. No, it was spicey hot.  Will not return nor recommend this place.

data.title: Best pizza in Champaign-Urbana and one of the best restaurants in the area
data.text:
My European friend took me when I visited Champaign for business, telling me that the place is new but he is so impressed for an American pizzeria. He was right. This is by far the v=best pizza restaurant in the area, and I can say this is one of the best restaurants in Champaign-Urbana.

Pizza is made in fire-oven, and the style is Roma I think. Thin crust, and fresh but not heavy (like typical horrible American pizzas) toppings. Of course, if you prefer American (or Chicago) style, this is not for you.

I have a while one with pistachio and I enjoyed a lot. Very crispy, not soggy (as one reviewer wrote) and fresh baked.

They also offer some appetizers (like cheese plate, ham plate, mix plate, various kinds of salad) We shared a mixed plate and enjoyed as well. Fresh ham and nice selection of cheese.

You can order beers (bottles) or wine (by the bottle, They did not offer by the glass).

Surprisingly (for Champaign), we needed to wait for maybe 10 minutes. I think they have too few tables considering the size of the place, but probably they'll put more tables as the place gets more popular.

I definitely come back when I go back to Champaign. I wish this place existed when I was there.

data.title: best pizza, best Italian pizza in USA !
data.text: the pizza that they serve the same that i ate in Italy, wood fired and the taste i feel myself in italy, basic nice decoration kind people.. best place to eat in USA
